title: How Much DNA in NEXUS?
fact: Did you know: The combined genome of all 26 Nexians adds up to over 80 billion base pairs — enough to build a LEGO tower over 550,000 km tall!

title: From Earth to the Moon — in Bricks
fact: Did you know: If you stacked one LEGO brick for every base pair in all Nexian genomes, you could reach the moon - and half way back!

title: NEXUS Conference, LEGO Edition
fact: Did you know: Over 2 days of a NEXUS conference, our LEGO robot could read more than 170,000 bricks — that’s about the size of TTN, the largest human gene

title: How Fast is Illumina?
fact: Did you know: An Illumina NovaSeq can sequence 48 human genomes in 2 days — the LEGO sequencer would need about 4,700 years to catch up!

title: LEGO Genome Distance
fact: Did you know: A single human genome, built from LEGO bricks, would stretch about 20,000 km — that’s half of the way around the Earth!

title: ETH to Orbit — in DNA Bricks
fact: Did you know: The LEGO stack for a single Nexian's genome would reach over 21,000 km — high enough to pass the International Space Station 20 times!

title: Lake Zurich Full of Bricks
fact: Did you know: If you laid out all the Nexian DNA bricks side-by-side, it would cover over 20 square kilometers — that's almost half the area of Lake Zurich!

title: LEGO vs 10 Years of NEXUS
fact: Did you know: In the 10 years since NEXUS was founded, the LEGO sequencer could only read about 10% of a single human genome!

title: DNA Backpack Challenge
fact: Did you know: If each base pair in the NEXUS team’s DNA were a LEGO brick, you'd nearly fill the entire atrium of the ETH Main Building — from floor to dome!

title: DNA Built From LEGO... Earth-Sized?
fact: Did you know: A human body has around 37 trillion cells — and if you rebuilt all that DNA using LEGO bricks, you'd need the DNA of just 1,860 people to match the volume of the entire Earth!

title: DNA Bricks for a Whole Human
fact: Did you know: If you built the DNA from every cell in your body using LEGO bricks, it would take LEGO over 6.5 trillion years to produce enough — that’s nearly 500 times the age of the universe!

title: One Genome, Please
fact: Did you know: LEGO could produce enough bricks to build a complete human genome in just 66 days!

title: Sequencing Bacteria with LEGO
fact: Did you know: Sequencing a small bacterial genome like E. coli — about 1.25 million base pairs — would take the LEGO sequencer 14.5 days. The tower would stretch all the way from Schlieren to ETH Hönggerberg!
